# Notable Health AI - Vendor Research Report

**Research Date:** November 2025
**Category:** Healthcare Automation Platform / Intelligent Automation

---

## Executive Summary

Notable is an AI-powered intelligent automation platform for healthcare operations, founded in 2017. Unlike ambient AI documentation players (Nuance DAX, Abridge, Suki), Notable focuses on **administrative and operational workflow automation** across the revenue cycle, patient access, and care operations. The company has raised $127M+ at a $600M valuation (2023) and processes over 1.5 million automated workflows daily across 12,000+ sites of care.

---

### Overview

| Attribute | Details |

| **Sites of Care** | 12,000+ |
| **Daily Automations** | 1.5M+ workflows |
| **Employees** | ~200-300 (estimated) |

- Innovaccer (AI agents for healthcare)
- Plenful (prior authorization)

---

## 2. Product Offerings & Automation Capabilities

### Platform Overview

Notable is the **first platform to combine artificial intelligence and robotic process automation (RPA)** to solve healthcare problems across the care continuum. The platform uses "Intelligent Agents" - AI-powered bots that work directly in EHRs and other systems.

### Core Product Categories

#### 2.1 Patient Registration & Intake (Front Desk AI Agent)
- Automated patient onboarding and reminders
- Digital check-ins and intake forms
- Insurance verification and card capture (computer vision)
- Payment collection
- Multi-language support (including Spanish)
- Consumer-grade mobile experience

**Outcomes:** 110,000+ monthly digital registrations at MUSC Health

#### 2.2 Scheduling & Referrals (Call Center AI Agent)
- Real-time patient matching
- Proactive outreach for scheduling
- Referral management (fax-to-EHR automation)
- Reduced scheduling-related call volume
- Patient acquisition and retention acceleration

**Outcomes:** Referral turnaround from 14 days to 2 days

#### 2.3 Intelligent Authorizations (Prior Auth)
- Automated prior authorization submission
- Status tracking and work queue cleanup
- Denial appeals automation
- Exception management for staff

**Outcomes:** 91% prior authorization success rate (Fort Healthcare)

#### 2.4 Care Gap Closure
- AI-powered identification of care gaps
- Patient outreach automation
- Chronic care management support
- Preventive care scheduling

#### 2.5 HCC Chart Review & Risk Adjustment
- Pre-visit chart reviews
- Risk adjustment coding assistance
- Clinical documentation improvement

#### 2.6 Revenue Cycle Management
- Billing automation
- A/R functions optimization
- Claims processing support

### Notable Sidekick
AI-powered assistant that enhances staff productivity by:
- Performing repetitive tasks
- Enabling faster decision-making
- Accelerating automation adoption

### Flow Builder (Announced October 2024)
Low-code interface that allows health systems to:
- Configure custom workflows
- Deploy intelligent agents without deep technical expertise
- Rapidly solve business challenges

---

## 3. Technology Stack

### Core Technologies

| Technology | Application |
|------------|-------------|
| **Artificial Intelligence** | Predictive classifiers, health plan prediction, care gap identification |
| **Machine Learning** | Patient matching, outcome prediction |
| **Natural Language Processing (NLP)** | Reading structured/unstructured patient notes, surfacing relevant insights |
| **Computer Vision** | Insurance card capture, document processing |
| **Robotic Process Automation (RPA)** | EHR data entry, workflow execution, system navigation |

### Technical Architecture

Notable's "digital assistants" combine:
1. **AI Layer:** NLP, computer vision, ML classifiers for intelligent decision-making
2. **RPA Layer:** Enterprise-grade automation for executing actions in EHR/PM systems
3. **Integration Layer:** APIs, HL7, FHIR for deep system connectivity

### Key Differentiators vs. Pure AI
- **Hybrid approach:** AI for intelligence + RPA for execution
- **Deep EHR writes:** Not just reads data but writes back to any field in any system
- **Configurable workflows:** White-labeled automations for specific health system needs

---

## 4. EHR Integrations

### Validated Integrations

| EHR System | Integration Level | Notes |
|------------|-------------------|-------|
| **Epic** | Deep integration | Read/write capabilities |
| **Oracle Cerner** | Deep integration | Cerner Open Developer Experience (CODE) validated, App Gallery listed |
| **MEDITECH** | Integrated | Confirmed integration |
| **Practice Management Systems** | Various | Multi-system support |

### Cerner Integration Details
- Validated through Cerner Ignite APIs
- Security, functionality, and UX validation completed
- Listed in Cerner App Gallery
- Customers report integration is "very smooth" with minimal Cerner engagement required

### Integration Methodologies
- APIs (REST, proprietary)
- HL7 interfaces
- FHIR standards
- RPA (for legacy systems)

---

## 5. Customer Case Studies

### MUSC Health (Medical University of South Carolina)

**Profile:** 16 hospitals, 350 telehealth sites, 830+ care locations across South Carolina

**Partnership:** Since late 2021 (4+ years)

| Metric | Result |
|--------|--------|
| Monthly Digital Registrations | 110,000 |
| Staff Hours Reallocated | 5,000+/month |
| Patient Satisfaction | 98% |
| No-Shows Avoided | 14,500 |
| No-Show Rate Reduction | 7.6% |
| Spanish Digital Intake Increase | 30% |

### North Kansas City Hospital
- **Result:** 2x increase in new patient appointments
- **Solution:** Intelligent Scheduling

### Intermountain Health
- **Result:** 25% reduction in patient check-in time
- **Solution:** Digital intake automation

### Fort Healthcare
- **Result:** 91% prior authorization success rate
- **Solution:** Automated prior authorizations

### Castell
- **Result:** Reduced average daily chart time from 4 hours to 1 hour
- **Solution:** Chart review automation

### Good Shepherd Penn Partners
- **Use Case:** Maximizing patient engagement, extending workforce capacity
- **Benefit:** No disruption to legacy technology infrastructure

### Additional Customers
- Gillette Children's Hospital
- Various academic health systems, large hospital systems, small hospital systems, and clinics

## 6. KLAS Research Ratings

### 2022 Emerging Technology Spotlight Report

| Category | Rating |
|----------|--------|
| Executive Involvement | A+ |
| Likely to Recommend | A+ |
| Would Purchase Again | 100% |

### KLAS Expert Analysis (Mike Davis)
> "Notable provides an RPA and AI platform that reduces administrative overhead costs, improves care coordination and improves patient engagement. The platform can automate patient service tasks, such as scheduling and completing patient intake forms, to reduce staffing overhead and can automate RCM processes to improve billing and A/R functions."

### KLAS Categories
Notable is listed in multiple KLAS categories:
- Patient Flow
- Virtual Nursing
- Scheduling
- Consumer Access & Engagement
- Personalized Care
- Customer Service
- Digital Front Door (DFD)
- Patient Education
- Ambient Intelligence

### Customer Demographics Surveyed
- 14% Academic health systems
- 43% Small hospital systems
- 14% Large hospital systems
- 29% Clinics

---

## 7. Differentiation from Ambient AI Players

### Notable vs. Ambient AI (Nuance, Abridge, Suki)

| Dimension | Notable | Ambient AI Players |
|-----------|---------|-------------------|
| **Primary Focus** | Administrative/operational automation | Clinical documentation |
| **Core Technology** | AI + RPA hybrid | NLP/Speech-to-text + LLMs |
| **Workflow Scope** | Pre-visit, during-visit, post-visit operations | During-visit documentation |
| **User Persona** | Front desk, schedulers, billing, care coordinators | Physicians, nurses |
| **Value Proposition** | Staff productivity, operational efficiency | Clinician burnout, documentation time |
| **Revenue Impact** | Prior auth, billing, A/R | Coding accuracy (indirect) |
| **Patient Touchpoints** | Direct (intake, scheduling, outreach) | Indirect (better notes) |

### Key Differentiators

1. **Operations-First, Not Documentation-First**
   - Notable automates administrative workflows; ambient AI automates note-taking
   - Complementary rather than competitive in many cases

2. **Full Practice Management Platform**
   - KLAS notes: "Notable offers a full practice management platform"
   - Beyond point solution for specific tasks

3. **RPA Execution Layer**
   - Can actually execute workflows in EHR, not just suggest
   - Works with legacy systems that lack modern APIs

4. **Patient-Facing Automation**
   - Direct patient interaction (SMS, web apps)
   - Consumer-grade experience for intake, scheduling

5. **Revenue Cycle Focus**
   - Prior authorization automation
   - Billing and A/R optimization
   - Direct ROI measurement

### Overlap Areas
- Both may address pre-visit chart review
- Both integrate with major EHRs
- Both positioned as workforce productivity tools

---

## 8. Pricing Information

**Pricing:** Not publicly disclosed

Based on industry context and KLAS data:
- Enterprise licensing model (likely per-site or per-workflow)
- ROI-based value selling
- Implementation services included

**Comparison Context:**
- Ambient AI scribes typically price at $400-700/provider/month
- RPA platforms often use volume-based or workflow-based pricing

---

## 9. 2024-2025 Product Updates

### Confirmed Announcements

**October 2024: Flow Builder Launch**
- New low-code interface for workflow configuration
- Enables health systems to deploy AI agents without deep technical resources
- Accelerates automation customization

**Ongoing 2024-2025:**
- Continued AI agent expansion
- Platform capabilities for broader healthcare operations

### Industry Context (2025 Trends)

From healthcare AI market analysis:
- Workflow efficiency emerging as key priority
- AI investment in healthcare projected: $20B (2024) â†’ $150B (5-year projection)
- Ambient documentation becoming commoditized; differentiation shifting to:
  - Prior authorization
  - Revenue cycle
  - Operational workflows

**Note:** Specific 2025-2026 roadmap details not publicly available. Recommend direct vendor inquiry.

## 10. Strengths & Considerations

### Strengths

| Strength | Evidence |
|----------|----------|
| Proven at scale | 12,000+ sites, 1.5M+ daily workflows |
| High customer satisfaction | KLAS A+ ratings, 100% would repurchase |
| Strong leadership advisory | Cleveland Clinic, Athenahealth, UCSF on board |
| Deep EHR integration | Epic, Cerner validated |
| Measurable ROI | Quantified outcomes (staff hours, no-show reduction) |
| Unique positioning | Operations automation vs. ambient documentation |

### Considerations

| Consideration | Notes |
|---------------|-------|
| Last funding 2023 | No announced funding since $100M Series B |
| Valuation gap | $600M vs. $5B+ ambient AI leaders (Abridge) |
| Limited ambient capabilities | Not competing in clinical documentation |
| US-focused | International presence unclear |
| Pricing opacity | No public pricing information |

---

## 11. Strategic Fit Assessment

### Best Fit For:
- Health systems with significant administrative burden
- Organizations seeking front-desk/call center automation
- Prior authorization bottleneck environments
- Multi-EHR environments (Epic + Cerner)
- Organizations wanting AI+RPA hybrid vs. pure AI

### May Not Fit For:
- Organizations primarily seeking ambient clinical documentation
- Small practices without workflow complexity
- Organizations requiring international/multi-language clinical documentation

### Complementary Strategy:
Notable could complement ambient AI vendors:
- Notable for operations (intake, scheduling, prior auth)
- Abridge/Nuance for clinical documentation
- Combined for full front-to-back automation
